newsitem.title: UK: Clean tanker rates strong in Mideast, Asia, Caribs.
newsitem.headline: Clean tanker rates strong in Mideast, Asia, Caribs.

text.p: Clean tanker chartering rates in the Mideast, Asia and the Caribbean strengthened over the week for various vessel sizes, ship brokers said.
Voyages for 55,000 tonners to Japan from the Mideast were worth W215 by the end of the week, they said.
"The ongoing demand for January ensures that the market will start the new year on very firm conditions," brokers E.A. Gibson said in a weekly report.
Rates in Asia for smaller 30,000 tonne vessels were also firm, brokers said, because of continuing delays in India and good winter demand for product.

Friday's fixtures saw rates for 29,000 tonne gas oil vessels making voyages from the Black Sea to the Mediterranean at a sickly W165, while Vitol took the 28,000 tonne Mormacsun from the Med to the USAC at W230. Cross-Med naphtha rates for 27,500 tonnes were assessed at around W225.

Caribs markets for 30,000 tonners moving to the USAC were buoyant and by Friday had reached, and perhaps surpassed, W300. "With the Venezuelans continuing to export large volumes of product," one broker said, "owners will have something to celebrate at Christmas.
